title: Evil food
data:
**Evil food** is a group of monsters added in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). Their appearance is the same as a regular egg, tripe ration, or food ration, making them somewhat similar to [mimics](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic"). However the food will still move and are not concealed, making it simple to identify them either by their movement or using the far look command. See also [evil coins](/wiki/Evil_coins "Evil coins").

Killing these monsters with a digestion attack will not give nutrition. However, you have a 1/3 chance of getting a [tripe ration](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) or [food ration](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) from slaying the corresponding evil food.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Bad egg](#Bad_egg)
- [2 Killer tripe ration](#Killer_tripe_ration)
- [3 Killer food ration](#Killer_food_ration)
- [4 References](#References)

| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | None                                                                                                             |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |
| A bad egg:* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* has [no eyes](/wiki/Eyeless "Eyeless").
* has no limbs.
* has no head.
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* does not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line4514](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line4514 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

Bad eggs are not related to rotten [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg"), i. e. regular eggs old enough to give the "Ugh. Rotten egg." message and [confuse](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") you.

html:
Evil food

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Evil food is a group of monsters added in SLASH'EM. Their appearance is the same as a regular egg, tripe ration, or food ration, making them somewhat similar to mimics. However the food will still move and are not concealed, making it simple to identify them either by their movement or using the far look command. See also evil coins.

Killing these monsters with a digestion attack will not give nutrition. However, you have a 1/3 chance of getting a tripe ration[1] or food ration[2] from slaying the corresponding evil food.

Contents

  • 1 Bad egg
  • 2 Killer tripe ration
  • 3 Killer food ration
  • 4 References

Bad egg

% bad egg
Difficulty 5
Attacks Bite 1d8
% bad egg
Difficulty 5
Attacks

Bite 1d8

Base level 4
Base experience 41
Speed 9
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 0
Nutritional value 0
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A bad egg:

  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.
  • has no limbs.
  • has no head.
  • is mindless.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line4514

Bad eggs are not related to rotten eggs, i. e. regular eggs old enough to give the "Ugh. Rotten egg." message and confuse you.

rawPage:
'''Evil food''' is a group of monsters added in [[SLASH'EM]]. Their appearance is the same as a regular egg, tripe ration, or food ration, making them somewhat similar to [[mimic]]s. However the food will still move and are not concealed, making it simple to identify them either by their movement or using the far look command. See also [[evil coins]].

Killing these monsters with a digestion attack will not give nutrition.
However, you have a 1/3 chance of getting a [[tripe ration]]{{refsrc|mon.c|218|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} or [[food ration]]{{refsrc|mon.c|222|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} from slaying the corresponding evil food.
